meanings.definition: A child whose parents are dead.
meanings.sent1: The orphan lived with his grandparents after his parents passed away.
meanings.sent2: The orphanage provided a home for children who had lost their parents.
meanings.sent3: The little orphan made everyone smile with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like an orphan, longing for the love she once had.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lonely orphan sitting by the window was etched in her memory.

meanings.definition: A young animal that has been abandoned or lost by its parents.
meanings.sent1: The orphaned kitten was found shivering in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The zoo took in the orphaned bear cub and cared for it.
meanings.sent3: The little orphan squirrel tried to climb a tree but kept slipping.
meanings.sent4: The orphaned duckling followed the kind farmer around like a loyal friend.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the orphaned fawn wandering alone in the forest was heart-wrenching.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is without protective affiliation, sponsorship, etc.
meanings.sent1: The small bookstore was an orphan in the age of online giants.
meanings.sent2: The orphan of a plan had no one to support its implementation.
meanings.sent3: The lonely pen on the desk felt like an orphan without its cap.
meanings.sent4: Her idea was an orphan in a sea of established theories.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house stood like an orphaned structure in the middle of the bustling city.
